title: I debated Alex O’Connor
January 17, 2025
The Problem of Evil: Debunked
description:
TIME STAMPS
0:00-1:40 Intro
1:40-4:40 Defining Terms
4:40- 8:40 Steelman Of Argument
8:55 Objection 1: assumption of the necessity condition
13:46 Objection 2- assumption that every instance of suffering must serve a morally justifiable role in order to be justified
16:17 Objection 3- assumption that God lacks overriding reasons to permit suffering
19:21 Objection 4- assumption that the existence of pro toto (evils that all things considered ought not happen) because they are not necessary for a greater good
24:48 Objection 5- assumption that a morally perfect God would create a perfect world from the onset 
29:23 Objection 6- failure to disambiguate intrinsic and instrumental value 
33:32 Objection 7- equivocation on the term evil
41:08- 45.54 summary/conclusion

If an all-powerful, all-good God exists, why does He allow suffering? This age-old question, often known as “the problem of evil,” has been debated by scholars, skeptics, and believers alike. Today, we’re examining this question from a fresh perspective, challenging the assumptions embedded within traditional arguments against the existence of God due to the presence of evil.

We’ll break down the core assumptions about necessity, the nature of intrinsic value, and the flexibility within theistic frameworks to allow for instrumental and ultimately defeasible evils. By carefully dissecting these assumptions, I’ll show why the classical theistic view offers a robust and nuanced response to these objections, one that accounts for the possibility of growth, relational dynamics, and even an eschatological vision where all suffering is ultimately redeemed.

Join me as we uncover why the problem of evil, when examined closely, may not be as insurmountable as it seems.

title: It's Okay To Have Doubts About Your Faith
description:
In this video, I’m responding to a heartfelt series of reasons someone shared for why they’re no longer a Christian. These kinds of reflections are deeply personal and often touch on issues that many people struggle with—questions about God’s hiddenness, the doctrine of hell, apparent contradictions, and much more.

My aim here isn’t to offer quick fixes or dismiss the sincerity of these questions. Instead, I want to walk through each concern thoughtfully, showing that Christian thinkers have wrestled with these same issues throughout history and that there are nuanced, substantial answers within the Christian tradition. From understanding the purpose behind divine hiddenness to grappling with biblical ethics and the nature of hell, I hope to shed light on how faith can coexist with deep inquiry.

If you’ve ever struggled with similar questions, or if you’re curious about how Christians respond to tough critiques of their faith, I invite you to explore these topics with an open mind. This video isn’t about forcing anyone back into belief; it’s about showing that the Christian faith has depth, resilience, and a rich tradition of engaging with tough questions.

#Deconstruction #FaithJourney #ChristianityExplained #Apologetics #FaithAndDoubt #DivineHiddenness #BiblicalEthics #DoctrineOfHell #ChristianResponses

title: Genesis 3:16 Revisited: Is Childbirth Pain Really the Curse?
description:
In this video, we explore a fresh perspective on Genesis 3:16, often viewed as the moment God curses women with painful childbirth. Scholars Christine Curley and Brian Peterson propose a different interpretation: that the verse speaks not to physical pain but to deep emotional grief and relational struggles tied to conception and fertility. By examining the original Hebrew terms, itsabon (sorrow) and herayon (conception), and literary devices within the text, we uncover how Genesis 3:16 may address a broader experience of emotional turmoil in a fallen world. Join us as we examine how this reinterpretation resonates with modern experiences of infertility and relational challenges, revealing a timeless message of shared human grief and struggle.

title: Hebrews 10:26-27: Is Willful Sin a Ticket to Hell?
description:
In today’s video, I’ll address a common misunderstanding of Hebrews 10:26-27. Some claim this passage teaches that Christians who sin willfully are condemned to hell. But is that really what the text says? We’ll break down the context, explore the deeper meaning behind “deliberate sin,” and uncover what the author of Hebrews was actually warning against. Spoiler alert: It’s not about everyday moral struggles. This is a message every believer needs to understand to stay grounded in their faith.

title: A TikTok Atheist Challenged Me...
description:
In this video, we take on the common misconceptions and myths spread by skeptics like Jeff4Truth regarding the dating and authorship of the Gospels. Are the Gospels really post-70 AD inventions? Is there no historical corroboration for the events they record? We address these claims head-on, diving into historical evidence, scholarly consensus, and some overlooked facts. If you're serious about understanding the historical reliability of the New Testament, this video is a must-watch!

Key Points Covered:

The misconception that the Gospels must be dated post-70 AD
Why arguments from silence are epistemologically weak
Historical evidence for early Gospel authorship, including Paul's writings
Addressing contradictions and supposed errors in the Gospel accounts
The significance of anonymity in ancient historiography
We also explore claims about Jesus predicting the destruction of the temple, anonymous Gospel authorship, and how modern scholarship interacts with these issues. Stay tuned for more videos that explore the reliability of the New Testament and join us in uncovering the truth behind these ancient texts.

title: From Crucifixion to Kingship: Jesus’ Death as Proof of His Godhood
description:
In this video, we dive deep into one of the most profound mysteries of Christianity: How Jesus' death on the cross is the ultimate proof of His divinity. Through biblical analysis and historical context, we'll explore the crucifixion as more than just a tragic event—it’s the enthronement of Jesus as King, a cosmic victory over death, and the final fulfillment of divine prophecy.

We’ll break down how the Gospel of Mark, ancient apocalyptic literature, and the combat myth traditions all point toward Jesus’ kingship being revealed through His death and resurrection. The crucifixion is not defeat—it’s where Jesus conquers death itself, making His claim to divinity undeniable.

Join me as we explore:

- Why Jesus’ death was essential for proving He is God
- How His crucifixion was both His defeat and His victory
- The ancient myths and scriptures that foreshadowed His triumph over death
- What this means for us today, and how it confirms the truth of Christianity

This is more than a historical recounting—it’s an exploration of the deep theological implications that affirm Jesus as God. Whether you're a skeptic, a believer, or simply curious, this video will shed new light on the power of the crucifixion.

title: The Problem of Evil For Atheists ft. Dr. Yujin Nagasawa
description:
Yujin Nagasawa is Professor of Philosophy and Kingfisher College Chair of the Philosophy of Religion and Ethics at the University of Oklahoma. He has authored many books, including The Problem of Evil for Atheists (OUP, 2024), Maximal God: A New Dence of Perfet Being Theism (OUP, 2017), Miracles: A Very Short Introduction (OUP, 2017), The Existence of God (Routledge, 2011), and God and Phenomenal Consciousness (CUP, 2008). He served as president of the British Society for the Philosophy of Religion from 2017 to 2019 and was the principal investigator for the Global Philosophy of Religion Project, a $2.42 million research initiative funded by the John Templeton Foundation and the Dynamic Investment Fund at the University of Birmingham, from 2020 to 2023.

Link to book for free: https://academic.oup.com/book/56378

title: Names STILL Prove Gospel Reliability | Luuk van de Weghe and Jason Wilson
description:
Discover the groundbreaking analysis of name occurrences in the Gospels and Acts! In this video, Luuk and Jason reveal their meticulous statistical research, demonstrating the historical reliability of these ancient texts. By comparing name frequencies and origins with reference distributions from Ilan Vol. 1 and Vol. 3, they uncover fascinating insights that challenge conventional theories. Watch as they debunk the "anonymous community transmission" hypothesis and validate the authenticity of the names recorded in the Gospels. Don't miss this shocking revelation in historical research!

Read the pre-print of Luuk and Jason’s peer-reviewed article for free here: http://arxiv.org/abs/2403.14883

Their published version in the Journal for the Study of the Historical Jesus is forthcoming. 

This research has passed through rigorous double-blind peer review by experts in the fields of biblical studies and statistics. It will be published this month in The Journal for the Study of the Historical Jesus, an academic publication by Brill that features critical scholarship on Jesus and his historical context. The free preprint version is identical to the closed-access publication, aside from formatting and copy editing improvements.

title: Gaming & Apologetics EP. 01
description: Trying something new. Let's see how it goes.

title: Reviewing Joe Rogan's Episode with Stephen Meyer PART TWO
description:
Join us for an intellectually stimulating and thought-provoking YouTube live stream as we delve into the recent appearance of renowned philosopher and author, Stephen Meyer, on the widely acclaimed Joe Rogan Podcast. We are thrilled to have esteemed guests Braxton Hunter and Richard Suttles join us for this insightful discussion!

Stephen Meyer is a leading figure in the fields of philosophy and intelligent design, known for his groundbreaking work on the origin of life and the universe. Recently, he graced the Joe Rogan Podcast with his presence, sharing his perspectives on life's most profound questions and the relationship between science and philosophy.

Braxton - Dr. Braxton Hunter is the president of Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary in Evansville, Indiana. He is the former president of the Conference of Southern Baptist Evangelists. As professor of apologetics , Dr. Hunter is passionate about the defense of the Christian faith in a skeptical world.

In addition to conducting evangelistic apologetics events, he has pastored two churches. He has engaged in several live, moderated, academic debates on theological issues and the evidence for the truth of Christianity with such notables as Matt Dillahunty (of the Atheist Experience), and Dan Barker (President of the Freedom From Religion Foundation). 

He holds a B.A. in expository preaching, an M.A. in Theology, a Ph.D. in Christian Apologetics from Trinity College and Seminary, and a DMin from Luther Rice Seminary, in Lithonia, GA.

title: Can We KNOW Christianity is True? W/ @lizjackson111
description:
Liz has dedicated her academic and professional career to understanding how individuals acquire and justify their religious knowledge. Her research delves into the various methods, justifications, and challenges associated with religious epistemology, shedding light on the complex nature of religious belief.

Liz Jackson is an Assistant Professor of Philosophy at Toronto Metropolitan University. She completed her PhD in Philosophy at the University of Notre Dame. Her research is in epistemology, on topics like rational belief and evidence, and philosophy of religion, on topics like Pascal's wager and the nature of faith. You can follow her on Instagram and Twitter at @lizjackson111 and also find her on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@lizjackson111.

title: Decoding Jesus' Prophecy: Why Dating the Gospels After 70 AD is not Necessary!
description:
In this video, we delve into one of the most intriguing prophecies made by Jesus in the New Testament - the prediction of the destruction of the temple in Jerusalem. While some scholars argue that this prophecy requires us to date the Gospels after the temple's destruction in 70 AD, we explore alternative explanations that suggest this is not necessarily the case. By examining the historical and textual evidence, we'll uncover compelling reasons why the dating of the Gospels is a complex issue that cannot be resolved solely through the interpretation of Jesus' prophecy. Join us on this journey of discovery.

title: Dear Christians. Don't be like this
description:
There are many damaging ways we as a church can interact with non-believers. This is one of them. 


Link to his video: https://youtube.com/shorts/oUnBQefKGaE?feature=share


"Usually even a non-Christian knows something about the earth, the heavens and the other elements of this world, about the motion and orbit of the stars and even their size and relative positions, about predictable eclipses of the un and moon, the cycles of the years and the seasons, about the kinds of animals, shrubs, stones, and so forth, and this knowledge he holds to as being certain from reason and experience. Now, it is disgraceful and dangerous thing for an infidel to hear a Christian, presumably giving meaning of Holy Scripture, talking nonsense of these topics; and we should prevent such an embarrassing situation, in which people show up vast ignorance in a Christian and laugh it to scorn. Reckless and incompetent expounders of Holy Scripture bring untold trouble and sorrow on their wise brethren when they are caught in one of their mischievous false opinions and are taken to task by those who are not bound by the authority of our sacred books. For then, to defend their utterly foolish and obvious untrue statements, they will try to call upon Holy Scripture for proof and even recite from memory many passages which they think support their position, although they understand neither what they say nor the things about which they make assertion." -St. Augustine of Hippo, De Genesi ad Litteram I.xix.39

title: "Are you a brain?" Dr. Josh Rasmussen
description:
ABOUT DR. RASMUSSEN
Associate Professor of Philosophy, Azusa Pacific University

"My purpose is to help you discover foundational truths that can serve you the most."

Joshua Rasmussen, Ph.D., is an Associate Professor of Philosophy, and his area of expertise is analytic metaphysics, with a focus on basic categories of reality, such as objects, ideas, and necessary existence. He is author of several books, including Defending the Correspondence Theory of Truth (Cambridge University Press, 2014), Necessary Existence (with Pruss; Oxford University Press, 2015), How Reason Can Lead to God (IVP, 2019), and Is God the Best Explanation of Things (with Felipe Leon, Palgrave 2019). He is also the founder of the Worldview Design YouTube channel, which helps people use reason to address the big questions of life.

Rasmussen values collaboration across disciplines and perspectives. He lives in Fontana, California, with his wife, Rachel, and their four children.


Follow Josh on his public platforms, including Facebook and Youtube.

Egyptologist Dr. Dave Falk has evidence for the exodus!
description:
In this interview, Dr. David Falk and I will be covering his work that suggests the exodus as recorded in the bible actually happened. 

Dr. David A. Falk holds three master's degrees and a Ph.D. in Egyptology from the University of Liverpool, and is a research associate at the Vancouver School of Theology.  He studies ancient Egypt and the Bible, and in 2020 published the book "The Ark of the Covenant in its Egyptian Context: An Illustrated Journey."

 Also, he is currently fundraising for a project on the exodus plagues. If you want to support him, here is his fundraiser page. https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-david-falk-write-a-book-on-the-exodus-plagues?fbclid=IwAR3rYZ6O3yvu6MdO_np38X-E8WmEscY3otqhJqjzI-0liCXsNIF4sDv9fv8&utm_campaign=p_cp_url&utm_medium=os&utm_source=customer

title: If God doesn't exist, do objective morals not exist?
description: The Moral argument. One of the most powerful arguments for God's existence. In this video I defend the first premise and show that objective moral values existing are contingent on the existence of God, and that they're nothing but an illusion under naturalism.

title: God's existence proved through morality (Introduction)
description: Does God exist? How can we prove that God exists? In this video we explore how morality is dependent on God existing, through something called the Moral Argument.
